review.reviewBody: This shirt is very comfortable and good looking. It is a useful/versatile shirt. It is made from stretchy fleece that is to me the perfect balance of warmth and breathability.  I have had the shirt for a few months and have had zero issues with the snaps coming out like other reviewers have noted. Maybe Patagonia has fixed the issue, or the reviewers mistreat their snaps? I always wear a size medium in shirts, but the small in this shirt fits perfectly as if it were a medium. Wish there were more colors or more products in this product family, I would definitely buy again.
review.name: Amazing shirt, but get the right size!

review.reviewBody: I was excited to Patagonia bring back what I thought was a remake of my very favorite Patagonia product of all time.  The synchilla micro fleece snap shirt.  I still have the one I purchased almost 17 years ago and it's an all time favorite.  I tried the last version they came out with several years ago and it just wasn't the same quality of fleece nor did it fit right (very boxy).  Still have it but it stays in the closet and I wear the vintage one.   I'm an avid fly fisherman and when I saw this shirt I jumped on it.  I love everything about the shirt, the fit is spot on, the fleece is similar to the old synchilla (maybe identical) and the reinforced collar, pocket flaps and cuffs are awesome.  I actually liked this better than my old one however there is one major flaw which ruins this shirt.  The snaps are terrible and they pull right out of the holes in the fleece.  I read this on other sites reviews but decided to take a chance and sadly its true.  SInce I had read this I was extra careful not to pull the shirt open by the material but by carefully grabbing the snaps.  No dice.  One by one they are pulling out.  You can pop them in again but they will pull out every time.  If they would only just USE METAL SNAPS it would have been a perfect shirt.  I don't even think the snaps are sewn in but they just seem to pop in when you stretch the hole a bit.  Poor design.  I have had the shirt probably three months and worn it a half dozen times and it has not been abused.  I can't understand why Patagonia ruined a perfectly good product.
review.name: Don't bother...
comment: Did you happen to warranty this? I bet they would honor it!

review.reviewBody: The Early Rise shirt is pure bliss to wear. Super cozy and comfortable. Great on the drift boat or on the trail or in the yard or out to dinner.
review.name: One of the best shirts ever

review.reviewBody:
This shirt is soft magic. Warm without overdoing it. Looks good enough to wear to an after-work event or casual office environment, back when those things existed. I have worn it under a Nano Air Vest and Arc'teryx shell to ski in, as a chilly-morning shacket while on a raft trip, and all the time around the house during colder months. Top-of-the-line and I'll be buying other colors. **Ink Black is more of a Charcoal Grey, if you ask me...

Fit: this fits Large. I am a Medium in most classically fitting shirts including Patagonia Nano Air Jackets, Nano Puff, Bandito Shirt, Fjord Shirt etc. and in this I bought the Small and was very happy with the sizing. I am slim but with relatively wide shoulders, not a weight lifter but well-muscled, and narrower hips. 

Questions about Patagonia gear like this? Ask for Johnny when you call the Gearheads
review.name: The Best Fall/Winter Shirt Ever? Yes

review.reviewBody: Runs very large. But it’s a great sun protector and wicks great. Soft and light weight. I love it.
review.name: Light weight and wicking

review.reviewBody: I use this shirt for mountain biking and it's great! It's super lightweight; very moisture wicking; very comfortable and absolutely flattering in terms of fit; and very packable if I ever need to bring it travelling or backpacking. I would definitely use it for other outdoor activities; field work; or even to go to the office.
review.name: Perfect summer shirt

review.reviewBody: I use it for mountain biking but would use it for other outdoor activities; field work; or even going to the office. Super lightweight: fit is very comfortable and absolutely flattering; very moisture wicking (dries extremely fast). Also packs super small so it's great for backpacking or travelling too.
review.name: Perfect summer shirt

review.reviewBody: The shirt fabric is super lightweight and really soft with a little stretch and a loose fit so it feels like a whisper. It’s an excellent quality shirt that is very versatile — I love it!
review.name: Super Cute, Comfortable Shirt

review.reviewBody:
Perfect travel shirt when paired with ultra merino Vneck T. 
Capsule wardrobe for summer travel.  Cool, breathable  Back is very blousy..  Okay untucked
Wish it hasd zippered pockets on both sides not just one
review.name: Summer vibes

review.reviewBody: I love the material, it's very light and breathes well. It washes and dries nicely, and packs well for travel. It does run large, I recommend sizing down.
review.name: Nice light shirt for hot days

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bet the XS and small women will say this is too baggy but for us larger women, who are trying to not have the cling around the gut, this blouse is the best! Very light and airy. I got a size large and often that size in OR tops is a bit too clingy, but I love the loose fit! I also bought a set of sun sleeves which work well with this top on a sunny or cooler day. I do tend to sweat a lot in it but mainly because I always have a pack on, but it dries so quickly. I use it for Mtn biking
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can wear this shirt literally all the time. It's appropriate for working in my PT clinic, great for throwing on after a run, and for hiking and general outdoor activities! Lightweight, the fabric has a nice flow and is cool in warm weather. It's a nice length and goes with a lot of different pants/bottoms
review.name: Best Shirt

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Great for my day to day. I bought a small and probebly could of easily went with and XS. Very light, comfortable.
review.name: Would definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: Love the trousers. Only reason not 5 stars is the come up a little big for me. Vidda pro I am a 50. Vidda pro vented I am a 52 these i bought a 50 and are a little on the large side. Was up well and everything else is perfect.
review.name: Come up large.

review.reviewBody: I got these for summer weight overlanding and backpacking pants.  This is my 5th pair of Fjallraven pants in different versions.  2 KEB, ABISKO, VIDDA Pro, and now these Abisko Lite.  All 44.  All very different sizes in the waste.  My vidda pro are a bit snug, 1 Keb is perfect and the other is snug, and these are massive.  Be prepared to have to find one that fits in adjacent sizes. For a European based size, it's disappointing since all my other european clothes are also 44 and arent as variable across several brands.
review.name: If the size was consistent...

review.reviewBody:
I wear a EU 44 on these (as well as the Keb and Vidda Pro). I find that these are the least true to size. There's no way I can wear these without a belt, and it was like that when I bought them brand new (meaning they did not stretch). 

I think these are probably the more discreet in styling between the three models I've owned. They're nice trousers, though I'm not sure they're actually more breathable than the Keb.  That said, they've held up to abuse, and perhaps are more rugged than the Keb given the Abisko Lite is comprised of more G-1000 material. 

Also, as stated in my Keb trouser review, the G-1000 colour fades with wear and washing - but that could be a combination of colour loss and wax loss (under the assumption the wax darkens the shade). 

Go to a store and try them on first.
review.name: Good, though a little large.

review.reviewBody:
I own two pairs of these pants. One pair I have had for almost 4 years now, and have worn them on lots of hikes and just day to day work. The only thing that I've had repaired, was a small hole I got in the butt about 2.5 years after using them (which was my doing on a camping trip). The crotch area has started to wear out from chafing but again, lots of hikes and daily wear. I have size 32 reg and I am 5' 8" 185 right now (i have larger quads and these fit fine). These also fit me at 194, due to the stretch material. These pants were a bit longer for me so I had them hemmed, as I also was not a fan of the buckle/strap system at the ankle. These and the kebs I find fit true to size due to the stretchy material being more forgiving. I own vidda pro ventilated and those fit tighter due to more g-1000 , I have sized up to 34's. 

Only fixes/updates I would like to see are; 
Either 2 way zip on legs and mosquito mesh in the leg vents. 

Ankle synch strap and buckles. Get rid of them entirely or switch to keb/vidda style or if looking for light option, go with shock cord drawstring. 

Nice to have; shorter lengths for us long torso, short leg types.
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody: I have a pair in every color of these trousers, they are that good.  Hey, Fjallraven, how about a few more solid colors in these?  Like Mountain Blue?  These trousers are the best pants I’ve ever owned, and I have the Keb, Keb Agile and Vidda Pros (some I got in Sweden almost 20 years ago) and these pants are next-level entirely.  Light as a feather and flexible exactly where they should be.  I wear them practically every day as I’ve never been as comfortable in any other trousers - the Keb Agile come close but they are a little more rugged and stiffer - these just feel and move in such a perfect way for me - they are so light.  And since I run hot I can even use them in Oregon’s winters with a layer on underneath... I give these my highest recommendation!
review.name: Simply the best

review.reviewBody: These trousers are really comfy, I bought them to replace worn out Kebs because I wanted the stretch fabric panels. I bought light olive all over because I find many of the colour combos too contrasting and they look great (hint hint Fjallraven). The thing I do wish however is that Fjallraven would cut more varied leg lengths, I’m not particularly short but bought 36” waist for room and these came so long! I have 3 turn ups despite the ankle cinches. Please make shorter versions like the Vidda pro!!!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody:
A bit of a disappointment after a few months of occasional use -a hole in the crotch ... :(
But else, like the trousers..

I love the design of these pants. The stretchy material at the right places gives you free motion. However, the g-1000 lite material is really not that durable. After less than two years the material at the butt area is worn out. It was also ripped while I was bushwhacking. Another downside is that the material keeps the body odour. If you sweat a lot or use a knee brace, this is not for you.
review.name: Great but not perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought these and was about to return them a week later thinking they were a lot like my Keb pants.  I am super happy I didn’t.  They are just as awesome as the Keb but I like these better for the summer.  I am 5’11, 215lbs and bough size 54(37”) reg in dark olive (my favourite colour in the Fjallraven line). 

Cons; only 2.  1.) the draw strap on the leg cuff isn’t as easy to use as the Keb pants but this is minor flaw.  2.) there is no screen mesh in the ventilation openings.  Residing in Canada, mosquitoes, deer flies and black flies love to help themselves in to every opening.  This con is also on the Keb and Vidda pants as well.  Even with these two cons, I still give them 5 stars.

Pros: They are light weight, packable and even for G1000 lite, they are extremely durable. Super comfortable with a lot of stretch.  Pockets are well designed.  They look great too!

I think these pants are great for hiking, exploring, travel, canoeist, camping especially in warmer temperatures.  I wore mine for camping, canoeing last summer and in to the fall.  No regrets. 

I’d definitely buy these again.  I am happy with my purchase.  

Disclosure, I wrote a review and I think I posted under the Abisko pant not the Abisko lite and said Fjallraven stopped making the dark green.  My bad, as I realized my mistake after.  The dark green or dark olive green as they call is still available for these pants.  Other than that the review is the same.
review.name: New favourite summer pant

review.reviewBody: These are my everyday and favorite pants. The fit, style and function are outstanding. They've spoiled me on pants as nothing else is really comparable now. I especially love the solid green color, as opposed to the mixed colors. Some of their combos are a bit bold, so the light green is great, and goes with most clothes. Wish they had the Vidda pros in the same solid color, which are also great pants.
review.name: The absolute best pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We took the Farpoint Trek 55 and a Fairview 55 on a backpacking trip to Thailand and Singapore. I highly recommend the trek 55 for its comfort when walking long distances, especially in hot climates. I was able to shove a LOT of stuff in this pack, and it was still skinny enough for the tightest street markets. The air cover/rain cover was a lifesaver, especially because I’ve had an airport conveyor eat one of my osprey bags last year. If you are going to travel and walk a lot, you can’t go wrong with the Farpoint Trek vs the Farpoint. Only downside between the two is that you may not always be able to carry on the Trek, as it’s taller than the regular Farpoint!
review.name: We took the Farpoint Trek

review.reviewBody:
Positives:
- Great feeling material
- Comfortable fit with the backpanel
- The grab handles on the bag are soft and nicely padded

Negatives:
- The travel cover is awful. It's just a loose fitting bag with a single handle. If your bag is fully packed and you're using the travel cover, it's a pain to carry with just that handle. No idea why they didn't put a handle on both sides instead of just the one.
- As mentioned in the other review, the hip belt pockets are tiny. They can store a small object like a pack of gum or keys, but you're not fitting much else in there.
- The internal compression straps don't stretch across the width of the interior compartment, leaving awkward space around the sides
- The hydration bladder is nestled in the back of the main compartment. If you're bag is packed full, then all that gear and clothing is going to be pressing right up against the bladder (hope your bladder doesn't leak!). This is really a problem with most Osprey bags of this size but still a frustrating feature.

I was hoping this bag would convince me that the praise Osprey gets is worth it but it was a poorly designed dud. Who is this bag for? It's features aren't very hiking friendly (no trekking pole attachments, the travel cover makes a poor raincover). For backpacking and travel, it's too cumbersome - it's not carry-on friendly and the bulky hip belts don't make it good for luggage/walking around an airport.

I'd recommend
review.name: A lackluster Frankenstein monster

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these from Backcountry over 3 years ago and they have been absolutely wonderful...warm and very comfortable...best slippers I've ever had.  I thought it might be time for a new pair so I ordered another pair from Backcountry.  The left slipper of the new pair has a VERY uncomfortable lump in the sole near the ball of the foot.  I tried wearing them for short periods for a couple of days thinking it might just need to be broken in.  But the left slipper remains unbearably uncomfortable to the point of causing foot pain.  It's an obvious defect in the slipper.  I've never run into anything similar in any type of footwear.  I'm returning them and may try my luck at re-ordering...and will hopefully get a pair without a factory defect.
review.name: Defective 2nd pair

review.reviewBody: Love these slippers.  Got the rubber sole version.  Can wear them outside doing chores, hauling in wood etc.  super warm and cozy. I usually wear a size 9 in most shoes, but sized down to 39. Perfect fit. Want more of these!! Highly recommend.
review.name: The best!

review.reviewBody: Save yourself the waste of money. These slippers look nice and are warm but they shed like crazy. These won?t last more then 1 season and I am already seeing the back heel completely wasted. Almost gone from the shedding of the wool
review.name: Horrible - waste of money

review.reviewBody:
I did a TON of research on Glerups (vs. other wool clog products) and hoped that my search for house slippers was over. I work from home, live in MN (very cold winters and warm summers), and  wanted a house slipper/shoe that is comfortable, breathable, naturally odor-inhibiting, and something that feels great when sitting at a desk, lounging on the couch, or when walking...all year.  After spending $115 on slippers (after using the 15% first-time discount) I was expecting exceptional quality, fit, and function. What I experienced left much to be desired.   

After researching and hearing that I should order one size smaller° by some and to °°order true to size°° by others, I was confused. But I opted for true to size.° First the positives: A) They fit true to size...like a glove. B) They were VERY comfortable when sitting still. C) The wool color combined with the honey rubber sole was very pleasing to the eye.

Now for the negatives: 1) The back area was cut much lower than the photos I had seen on several sites online.  Most online photos show about 1 inch of exposed felt at the back (above the sole material). Mine had 1/2 inch, but that difference meant that the heel area just felt awkward and constantly slipped when walking. Sort of like wearing a wool flip flop, not a wool slipper. 2) The left slipper° wool thickness was VERY uneven, over 1/2 inch°° thick at about the 11 AM position of the opening but less than .25 inch° at the 4 PM position. In the official Glerups video they demonstrate how they measure for evenness.  3) The extra piece of felt sewn into the heal area of the left slipper was shifted very off center to the right making it look weird. 4) The person who trimmed the foot opening was sloppy, making the side profile of the foot uneven. 5) There was excess glue on two spots of the heel, making it very shiny. I rubbed hard and eventually got it off. By this point I was second guessing my purchase. This pair missed a Quality Control check.  6) Finally, when walking in the slippers, my feet/ankles turned out, making me feel somewhat unstable. I knew about the rocking sole° effect by reading reviews on other sites, but thought that perhaps the issue was overstated and that the rubber might compress and hug the ground more when standing/walking. Not so. If your ankles naturally turn in our out, or if your heel wears unevenly on normal shoes, I would highly recommend that you avoid the rubber sole versions and opt for the leather sole (which, based on logic, should conform more to the floor)...and consider an insole from the Glerups website to level your foot. Additionally, I am at a loss as to why they designed and make a rounded bottom slipper or shoe (rubber or leather sole). Yes, our natural heel profile is rounded when in the air, but the heel/sole of our feet naturally flatten to create optimal surface contact for stability. The Glerups? rubber sole inhibited my stability. It seems like a design miss. I am sincere when I ask who is helped by a rocking sole design?

I ended up calling Backcountry customer service and found them very helpful. They quickly sent me a return label for my rubber-soled SLIPPER and helped process an order for the Glerups leather-soled SHOE. I am really hoping for higher quality and a better fit and feel on my second Glerups pair.  

I think Glerups has a great product concept with a lovely family-owned business story, along with lots of glowing reviews on high profile websites. I want to add a positive review to the mix...if my next pair appears and functions better.  I truly hope this review helps other consumers as well as helping the Glerups company succeed by considering an improved rubber-sole design and better consistency with Quality Control.

PS - You might also find it helpful knowing what Glerups model numbers mean: A is shoe, B is slipper, G is boot, and R means rubber sole. So, AR means a shoe with rubber sole, B is leather slipper, GR is rubber sole boot, etc.
review.name: Disappointed, expecting better next time
comment: Did the leather soles end up being better?

review.reviewBody: They fit and look okay, but the color I got looked different compared to the picture.
review.name: Ok but Inaccurate Color

review.reviewBody:
Nobody needs a $134 slipper. The idea of the glerups is insane just on the face.

And yet, these slippers have solved a life-long problem for me. I have cold feet. But my feet sweat in normal, fleecy slippers.

The wool on the glerups is so thick that my feet never get cold anymore and so breathable that they never sweat.

I feel guilty admitting that I spend over a hundred bucks on a pair of slippers. But they are *so* good that I'd do it again. Absolutely amazing.
review.name: Ludicrous. And awesome.

review.reviewBody: I love these slippers and they fit well, but they’re just not durable. I found that after wearing them for a few months the stitching at the heel blew out on both feet. I took them to my tailor to be restitched, but now they’re separating *again* just past the repaired stitches. For the price, this lever of quality is just unacceptable. Do not buy.
review.name: Nice, but not durable

review.reviewBody: I'd heard good things and as soon as I had them on I found them exceptionally comfy. They're warm but breathable; snug but have good grip. My one gripe, within a few months they began to fray and holes opened up around the toes. I still wear them and I might get another pair but I expect for slippers that cost over $100 to hold up for more than a single winter. I'm a little disappointed they haven't been made to a higher standard, given the cost and reputation.
review.name: Phenomenally Comfortable, not so durable

review.reviewBody:
Received the charcoal Glerups slip on (low back), rubber sole today.  30 minutes after putting them on and walking around,  I came right back and ordered the cranberry shoe with higher backs so I would have options. 

My regular shoe size is women's 9.5W.  The 40.0 fit perfectly with a thinnish smartwool sock and a little loose when barefoot. If I planned on wearing thick socks then maybe a 41 would be better but these are perfect for me as-is.
review.name: Ordered a second style within 30 minutes

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Glerups and they still are the best when it comes to slippers.

The first pair I had were bought from a different place of business and I bought the suede bottoms in a women's size7/37., figuring I would give myself rooms for socks. They lasted me two years with a few little fixable blow outs until the I went to pull a wool blob off the insole and it all came off. they also stretched out a lot. And the soles got very dirty, despite having a clean house and never wearing them outside. They were also not very form fitting.

So it was time to get another pair which lead me to these and I love/prefer them to my original pair. I decided to size down to a 6/36 so I wouldn't have to schlep around in big slippers, I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to wear socks with them but it wasn't an issue at all. These are form fitting, true to size, the soles don't get filthy ( and if they do I can very easily clean them due to the rubber) Still,no sweaty feet as with typical slippers. 

I am very happy with my choice.

The only downfall was that I would have loved to have seen purple as an option.

I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a good pair of slippers.
review.name: Pricey But Worth Every Cent

name: The Slip-On Rubber Slipper

review.reviewBody: Worthless. The previous incarnation of these gaiters was great. I used them extensively for bushwacking and they held up with aplomb. Even though they were lightweight, they endured hundreds of miles of off trail hiking. The straps never once came loose. But OR decided to "improve" them by adding wrap around hooks to ensure the straps wouldn't come loose. Including when you're trying to remove the gaites! After a hard day on the trail, you have to bend over and struggle, manipulate, contort to try to get them off. Finally, after twenty hikes or so, I just ripped them off and threw them in the trash where they belong. My last OR product.
review.name: Terrible design "upgrade"

review.reviewBody: The primary purpose of these was to stop dust and other trail junk from entering my boots during the summer. They do a great job at that and now I don't have to stop every hour to clean out my boots. However I have noticed that the hardware on my boots is wearing a hole through one of the gaiters. For reference, I am wearing Zambalan Baltero boots. This is not the fault of the gaiter but is something to consider. I will patch them and see how long they last.
review.name: Do the job, but unsure about durability

review.reviewBody: Second time I used these the elastic strap broke! Poor design.
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: Strop broke and was lost on first hike. Bad design, don't buy....
review.name: Junk

review.reviewBody: I use these low gaiters primary for day hikes. They work well with the exception of the straps that wrap around the bottom of your shoe/boot. I have repaired (re-sowing) or had them repaired several (more than 4) times.
review.name: Good, But ...

review.reviewBody: I really like the fabric and versatility of this gaiter. however, the front hooking mechanism is plastic and quite small that it will not fit on the metal ring that comes on my hiking books especially for connecting to gaiters. the gaiter hook will certainly connect to the shoelace itself but would be more versatile if the hook was just a millimeter wider..
review.name: great 3-season gaiter for light hikers/sneakers!

review.reviewBody: Multiple days desert hiking kept debris out of our boots. Also nice to have the extra layer of protection brushing up against the cacti! Easy on & off, very glad we made the purchase.
review.name: Worth the money

review.reviewBody: We have 3 pair of these in the family. Mine broke on second try and I lost pieces of attachments. The other 2 pair in family work great! Purchase made July 15/23.I contacted Outdoor Research July 27/23 and they have NOT responded as yet......
review.name: Ferrosi Thru Gaiters

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The under-shoe strap was severed in half after the first use. Time to file a warranty claim.
review.name: Not made for the CO Rockies

review.reviewBody: These may be a cute accessory for a shopping trip and a latte but they are clearly not up to actual hiking. The second day I had them on the elastic thread (yes - it is THREAD) holding the entire thing together broke. I would have repaired them but the hook for the shoelace was lost in the vegetation. They are now garbage - actually they were quite clearly garbage to begin with - unfortunately garbage that someone paid decent money for (was a gift) I strongly suggest OR test stuff like this before selling it for a purpose it is not at all suited for. You do know that trails are not sidewalks, right? I mean - there are sticks that get caught in things like ELASTIC THREAD and can break it.
review.name: Lasted Two Whole Days!

name: Ferrosi Thru Gaiter

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Mid B-Dry Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
++ to be clear i did order the wide version of these++

I've only just opened out of the box and wore around the house a bit.  I ordered the 10 wide as that's usually what i wear.  I'm not going to be able to stuff thicker hiking socks in the shoe like i can on other brands in a comparable size but with a nice fitting boot that may not matter.  Time will tell but so far out of the box I'm very happy with my purchase.  for reference my left foot is 260mm long and my right foot is 265mm long and both are 110mm wide
review.name: So far So good

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Mid B-Dry Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was recently introduced to the low version of this shoe and absolutely love them and figured I had to try the mids. The mids fit and feel very similar just with a higher cuff. The cuff is mid-height and not super stiff. Don't expect a ton of support but rather a nice level of protection and something just to assist the stability in your ankles. They have the same great arch support as the lows with extra bits of cushion at the heel and ball of the foot and they have the same wider forefoot and narrower heel which I find to be accommodating for my feet. The waterproof liner also works great! It breathes well enough to keep my feet comfortable on hotter days but also keeps the weather out. Super satisfied!
review.name: Perfect lightweight mid hiker!

name: Sawtooth X Mid B-Dry Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kettle works great and have yet to use the cups camping. I assumed the base would be like the detour pots with the heavy base but they are not.
review.name: Detour Kettle set

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this cup and kettle kit for free from influenster and Sea to Summit for free in exchange for my honest opinion! Look at how freaking cute it is! I love it. I love that it is so easy to wash and can be collapsed down for easy storage and portability! It feels extremely durable and it heated up my water for tea perfectly. I can not wait to get more use out of this while camping! It is such a great set to have!
review.name: Perfect for camping!

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how easily compact-able this kettle set is compared to a non collapsible kettle when packing, it saved me so much room and I didn’t have to worry about losing a cup when they pack perfectly inside with the little rubber band. I used this with my gas camper stove and it heated up the water for my water surprisingly quickly for me, considering all the rubber. It did insulate the liquid and kept my drink hot for a good while compared to my all metal mug! Definitely getting more collapsing food gear.
review.name: Took up little space, made delicious coffee

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are very practical and the model is simple and pretty, I love it because it can be stored easily and thus avoid losing them, the material is of excellent quality and durability, they keep whatever you put in it warm, I love the glasses, they are a good size and can also be stack them together to keep them together, the jug also has a band to keep them together after storing them due to the way they are folded and stored, they can be taken anywhere without taking up much space and always keep them together.
review.name: very pretty and resistant

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can’t wait to try this next camping trip will totally be useful ! I love that u can do it all with so simple items ! I’m sure I’ll be happy with it . I really like it
review.name: Easy set up

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how heavy duty this set is it will last a lifetime it’s a camping staple also good to have for hurricane season here in Fl the heat distribution is great it heats up even and quickly and you can use it for so much from drinks to even soup I love it
review.name: Love

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so cute and easy to carry in backpack or bag! They are very durable, easy to clean and they distribute heat all around. I actually warmed some soup on it and it worked great!! I can’t wait to use it again!
review.name: So easy to store

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This set looks strong and durable.  It’s folds flat so perfect for traveling.  It has expandable silicone side walls with stainless steel bottom to heated up quickly for tea or soup. Also the came with two cups inside so ready to drink.
review.name: Packable cooking

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As someone who loves the great outdoors and is an avid fisherman, this handy product is perfect for on the go. It is very durable and sturdy, I like to make soups and or just boil plain water. It also comes with two cups that collapse and are fairly a decent size, perhaps 2 cups worth
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this product for free from Influenster in exchange for my honest review. Finally got it and me and my girlfriend were so excited to try it and we did in our back yard made some smores and some hot tea over the fire. It’s so easy to clean and also wow amazing to carry around fits everywhere. Really keeps the tea pretty hot so goood quality for sure!
review.name: Amazing!

name: Detour Stainless Steel Cutlery 3-Piece Set - 1 Person

review.reviewBody: I took off the stock Anvl alloy bars on my Transition Scout and plopped these carbon bars on....let me first say i am a HUGE fan of the 35mm rise. From a previous accident i would get pretty constant upper neck/shoulder pain with any climbing, if i was in the saddle for hours i would end my ride in pain. Having the 35mm rise bar honestly has helped a lot with the tension and flare ups! Also, lets talk about the difference these have with arm pump! The bars are stiff and responsive. love love love. I cut mine down to 760mm and because of the rise they felt a little wide at first, but the more i rode it the better they felt.
review.name: one up for the win

review.reviewBody:
Wow these bars are great! Coming from some alloy bars and riding really chunky, chattery trails in AZ, I am blown away by the compliance of these bars. Great price compared to some other options. Fit and finish seems great so far. The marking for cutting the width and installing are great. 
100 miles in and I will be putting these on my other bike as well

Do yourself, and your arms a favor.
review.name: Your arms will thank you

review.reviewBody:
Really like the handlebar.  I cut the bar down from 800 to 760 for my XC machine.  I thought that I really liked my prior carbon bar (damaged in crash) but the One Up seems to reduce the chatter to the hands better.  That alone makes it worth the upgrade.  I pinged my gear head asking for a recommendation and he suggested this bar.  I'm glad he did.  

My only complaint is that I wish One Up made a bar with less rise.  This will do in the absence of a 0 or 10 degree rise option though.
review.name: Solid bar, less chatter

review.reviewBody: I've had these bars on my bike for about two months now. They are amazing carbon bars but I'm not sure I can really noticed the claimed difference of vertical input versus a standard 35mm bar. The bars are perfectly stiff on steering input and handle great all around. I really like what OneUp is doing across the board in the industry but if you have bars you are happy with, I'm not sure spending the money on these for the vertical compliance.
review.name: Great carbon bar

review.reviewBody: Replaced Renthals with these bars and the difference is clear. They are definitely more pliable, but still still plenty tough for plowing through chunk.
review.name: Great feel

review.reviewBody: Love the design, weight and stiffness of these bars. But about 10 months after purchase the clear coat started peeling off. Unfortunately, I waited a month too long as OneUp only offers a 1-year warranty. My Easton Haven bars lasted about 5 or 6 years before they started peeling.
review.name: Nice bar but...

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to get this bar and then realized it wouldn?t fit my current stem.  I?m not usually a fan of 35 mm bars because they are so stiff but these seem to not fit that norm.  Fit and finish were great just wish they made them in other sizes.  Otherwise a very nice feeling and looking bar.
review.name: Great bar but wish they mad it in 31.8

review.reviewBody: I love these bars! Say what you will about companies making wild claims to sell their product... these bars are waaaay more comfy and compliant than the other high-end bars I have had. I will put these on every build I have until something better comes along.
review.name: Amaze.

review.reviewBody: These things are incredible! Put these on my 2019 Trek Fuel Ex 9.7 trail bike and could not be happier. So much less input to the hands! Planning to pick up a second set for the hard--tail as well.
review.name: Incredible!

review.reviewBody: Got these for my wife?s IBIS. The 800mm width is exactly what she needed. And the 20 mm rise was perfect. Super lightweight. Easy on the hands and handle great. She Loves these bars!!!
review.name: Amazing bars

name: Carbon Handlebar

This beanie fits very small.

I’m 6-3 and average head size, and this beanie fits too tight.

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket as a gift and it is so great! Super high quality and comfortable! The shipping was super prompt and arrived days before I even expected the package! Overall I am super happy with my purchase and will be shopping here again!
review.name: Awesome Product and Shipping

review.reviewBody:
Suggest trying this on before purchasing...

The jacket felt stiff, as others have mentioned. I've read in other reviews that it does soften up a bit. However, it felt "tight" on my back in the area between the base of my neck and shoulder blades. It was also tight in my armpits. Given these two issues, I just returned it.
review.name: Really wanted to like this jacket...

review.reviewBody:
This is a classic. It is not as soft as some modern fleece (e.g the TNF Denali) but it is hard-wearing and very useful both on the mountain and in town. It is very wind-resistant - I use it as a jacket, not a mid-layer.

My kids grew up using this model through middle school, handed down to a younger sibling. I've had at least one in my closet for years.

A true classic.
review.name: An absolute classic!

review.reviewBody: Looks great and fits great
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
Super comfy and warm! It was 0 degrees today in MN and this was the perfect jacket over a flannel. ***Note here, I say jacket. THIS IS NOT A MID-LAYER!*** This jacket does not breathe. It is wind resistant AF.
(If you're looking for a breathable mid layer check out Patagonia's Snap fleece)
I have noticed other reviews saying this jacket sheds. I have NOT noticed this and doubt I'll have this issue.
It does not get 5 stars because of the fit, which isn't awful.... But the arms a a little too long and the torso is a little too short.
Buy it! If you can find it in stock! Woot!
review.name: Oh yeah!

name: Classic Retro-X Jacket - Men's
Throwback Vibes ~ Patagonia Retro-X Fleece

description: Buy the Crank Brothers Stamp 7 Exclusive Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stamp 7 Exclusive Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Stamp 7 Exclusive Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The grip is absolutely amazing, I mountain bike with vans and with these pedals I?ve absolutely no grip issues at all. Very smooth and very good looking too. The material seems to be very well made. I?m size 9 on shoes and bought the large pedals, perfect for me.
review.name: Perfect pedals for grip

review.reviewBody: Excellent pedal good grip the color is amazing  recomendable 100% good material good paint ,good for downhill and trail very light weight recommend, Your feet do not come off because of the good hit I use them with leatt and I love them, it is already the third pair that I buy and I do not regret
review.name: Pedals

review.reviewBody: I've put in about 250 miles with these pedals on trails ranging from light neighborhood trails to super techy and I'm still loving them. I have size 12.5 shoes, so the larger size of these pedals feels amazing. The only negative I would say is that if you aren't used to larger pedals, you might have to get used to the size at first - i.e. you'll probably pedal strike often while you are getting used to the size.
review.name: Great Feel / Beautiful Color

review.reviewBody: I've purchased 2 pairs of these pedals unfortunately. They were stiff out of the box and, instead of loosening up over time, have become increasingly stiff. I sent them back to CrankBrothers and they told me they had "vapor locked". No idea what that means relative to a set of pedals. They "repaired" them and sent them back to me but they were super stiff right out of the box and have become unusably stiff again. I'm sending them back again but I'm also having to buy some other pedals because these just aren't durable enough. For the record I weigh 135 pounds and have spent years riding other flats with no problems. These just struggle.
review.name: Vapor Lock?

name: Stamp 7 Exclusive Pedals

review.reviewBody: Very durable.  Comfortable fit, my husband wears them for work as well as for casual outings.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace the now discontinued "full-swing" pants. They are a bit stiffer, but still have that high quality I'm looking for.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I like the pants including the side pockets and hammer loop. The relaxed flex is good for my old bones.
I don't like the small watch/change pocket anymore. it used to be an inch or so deep and was handy for keeping wirenuts, screws, or other small hardware handy.
Now it's 2 1/2 inches deep and pretty much useless. Good luck getting small hardware out of there. It's hard to imagine what anybody thought that was useful for.
review.name: Good work pants.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: You need to stock more pants in 36" inseam. You are sold out in that size almost entirely

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fit well, warm, and are rugged.  My only complaint is the pants no longer come in stone (off white Khaki) color.
review.name: Nice looking, warm, fit well, and are rugged.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's

review.name: Great work pants

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's

review.name: I'm impressed!

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Dungaree Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Would love to have a Carhartt pants option without hammer loop (and slightly dressier and less baggy) with leg pockets.  Make available in full range of colors.  There is a market for such if you can make it obvious amidst the noise of constantly shifting model numbers.
review.name: Similar Design Without Loop?

description: Buy the Marmot Highlander Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Highlander Down Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Highlander Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are one of the best Down jackets I have in my wardrobe! Fits perfectly and is Sufficiently warm to take a stroll through the city on a snowy winter evening.
I had packed this jacket on my trip to Vail, CO this winter season and almost wore them every night while touring the beautiful Vail village! Lightweight, warm and protects well against the wind! They do come in some cool of color choices! I might be getting a 2nd one in a different color!
review.name: One of the best Down jackets from Marmot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality jacket and best price on the market! Small  great for 5’5” tall
review.name: Great fit and price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very Warm and very light.  I highly recommend this jacket
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I purchased my Rad jacket about two month ago and it's a great looking jacket and fits pretty good for being a women's jacket. The problem is that I ordered a men's XS small and received a XS women's jacket in the same color, I could tell as right off by the cut that it was not a men's jacket. I thought about sending it back but it was over two weeks before I received my jacket and who knows how long it would take to send it back and receive another jacket.
review.name: Nice Puffer Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I love down puffer jackets that’s all I wear in the freezing winters.I own many brands, I purchased two different colors because of the clearance. I must say wow great quality fantastic colors true to sizing is excellent.
You can’t go wrong with a down puffer they are super lightweight and extremely warm. I have a closet full. I may puff into another country..
Also, when washing the down jacket wash in cold water with very little soap about a quarter of the amount for a normal one load. Dry the jacket on air or low heat with three tennis balls inside  dryer The coat will come out looking at its best.
review.name: Highlander down puffer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have yet to be disappointed with a Marmot product. This jacket has great colors, fit, comfort and warmth. Love it!
review.name: Never been disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love Marmot, always have.  Great quality.  This jacket is lightweight and has wonderful features however if self-packing is something you require this jacket does not pack into it’s own pocket. I needed something for backpacking and space is an issue. If they dropped the fill by 20% you might have a chance of self packing (they would also need to add a double zipper to a pocket to make it work).
review.name: Well constructed high quality but NOT self-packing

review.reviewBody: I ended up buying 2x of these jackets while they were on sale. Amazing jacket for the price, size down for a snug fit. I ordered a medium and small, I prefer the small.
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: I wanted a down puffer jacket but I didn't want the typical patagucci brand that everyone has. I opted for this brand which is also a decent brand and with decent reviews. I got it and am super pleased with it. It keeps me very warm. I run hot mostly so I don't use the jacket too much but when I do use it, it looks elegant and keeps me warm. Its very cute. I'm a small in most of my tops and this is a small, fits perfect.
review.name: Overall, great jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my husband. We loved it so much we got one for our grandson! True to size, great fit and excellent quality
review.name: Beautiful jacket

name: Highlander Down Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good fit and finish. Nice warm, comfortable ski helmet.
review.name: Smart Head Protection

review.reviewBody: This helmet has treated me very well for the most part, but the goggle strap's elastic stretched out and now just dangles from the back of my helmet and doesn't keep my goggles secure. This helmet would benefit from a more secure goggle attachment mechanism or Smith could do us all a favor by offering a replacement for this very simple and small part (I asked and they said no)
review.name: great helmet, but the goggle strap got stretched out and is not replacable

review.reviewBody: This helmet DOES run small. I wear a medium in other Smith helmet styles, but needed a large in this style. First thing I noticed was the interior of this helmet was made out of a softer material than other helmets. It made it feel cozy and in temps below freezing I didn’t need an extra layer to keep my head warm. It shouldn’t be sold as a women’s helmet, but an EVERYONE’S helmet. I love the vents that open during warm weather too. But best of all, it kept my head safe. I hit an icy patch going into a turn too quickly and soon was down. The momentum of the fall pulled my upper body forward and soon I was traveling down a steep slope head first. My noggin didn’t feel a thing and was completely safe. I still can’t believe we all used to ski without helmets in the 80’s and 90’s.
review.name: Most comfortable helmet ever!

review.reviewBody: I have always loved Smith products and this is no exception! Works perfectly with my goggles too :)
review.name: I have always loved Smith

review.reviewBody: Daughters first "adult" helmet.  She is coming off kids Smith units and loves the fit, how light it feels, and the adjustable venting.  I liked MIPS and solid protection
review.name: Great fit, light and love the venting adj

review.reviewBody:
Perfect fit, with varying degrees of tightening if your wearing a skull cap or not.. 
safe and secure feel..
review.name: Perfect fit, with varying degrees

review.reviewBody: I would never buy another Smith Helmet. The first one I bought I took straight back to the shop as the wind was blowing through the ear pads so loudly I couldn’t hear myself think and it gave me a terrible headache. The shop replaced it with another one which was not as bad but there is a plastic piece above the ears which holds the wires for the size adjustment and on one side it is lower which causes my ear to ache very badly all day and when I take the helmet off it is excruciating. It’s a terrible helmet.
review.name: Terrible Helmet

review.reviewBody: My new Smith Vantage helmet is light, comfortable and perfect for someone with a smaller head (like me!)
review.name: Smith Vantage

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet! I couldn’t be happier with it!
review.name: I love this helmet! I

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing Smith helmets for years and needed to upgrade to MIPS. As always, great fit, super comfortable, and the matte white is a clean look.
review.name: Women’s Vantage

review.reviewBody: Don’t do it. Yes they are light, but they warp as soon as they get hot and will rub and squeak endlessly. Put on generic sram rotors (maybe 40 grams heavier) and they work great.
review.name: Couldn’t be trued

review.reviewBody: The rotors are great however Backcountry/Competitive you really need to put these in a box to ship not an unpadded envelope. I'm almost afraid to install these for fear they were warped while being abused in transit and am considering returning them. You can do better.
review.name: Please package better for shipping.

review.reviewBody: backcountry may need to look at the material handling process for items like brake rotors.  Rotor was bent more than the one I was replacing.    Leaving on a trip, so I had to use it.  Not a huge deal as I was able to get it reasonably straight with a few bends.  Just shouldn't need to make that effort when you spend full retail on a new brake rotor.
review.name: might be a material handling issue

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love my new nano puff. Plan to use it when I travel to Greece this March. It is really nice for running errands and having a warm, light layer.
review.name: Great lightweight packable warm layer

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved the jacket.  Tried on. Returned because I needed a medium instead of a large
review.name: Loved the jacket

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: When I opened the package, I could immediately smell some kind of overly scented detergent, air freshener, perfume...not sure what it was, but it was overwhelming, so I am returning it. It doesn't otherwise look used, but it smells like someone wore it without taking the tag off and returned it. Looks like you have to pay return shipping no matter what, but at least shipping isn't too expensive.
review.name: Scented?

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket in my opinion is not only stylish (I have the mauve, I always love the two toned look with the zippers being a different color) but it is definitely practical and does the job! I bought this jacket because it has a hood and is synthetic so it is best for being up in the mountains. It’s packable in my pack for the summits and I used it on Belford, Oxford, longs peak and held up perfectly!! Sizing was great! 5’7 148lbs I bought a medium.
review.name: Best Jacket!!

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket, I got it in the mauvey-lavender color. But the sleeves were weirdly too long - like three inches too long. I tried just rolling them up, but that looked stupid.  So, I took a deep breath and shortened them. Myself.  I was able to salvage the original edging and have an amazing
sewing machine  plus 55 years of sewing experience, so now it  looks and fit greats.
review.name: Great jacket, but..,

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The jacket fit snug with a sweater on.  It's very light weight but I think it will be good for early Fall and Spring.  Unfortunately, I had to return it because it had been worn.  It reeked of perfume, had spots on the front, as well on the lining.  I packed it up and returned it.  I will wait patiently for a NEW one to arrive.
review.name: Great Coat - Too bad it was used :{

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Omg.
I love Patagonia gear.
It's stylish.
Keeps me warm.
Fashionable.
Hot color.
Not too puffy.
Hooded for xtra head warmth.
Fits perfectly.
Love it!!!
& You will too.
Kinda $$ but totally worth it.
It'll last forever..
review.name: Omg. Love.

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought it as a gift and feedback was great! Fit true to size and keeps them warm without restricting movement. Excellent quality.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Review on the mighty Mo perfect little beauty, backpack and stove. I got to learn how to use mine. Turn it well, love it.
review.name: Mighty mo

review.reviewBody: The plastic at the base of this stove melted on first use. I'm really disappointed with my purchase. I feel like a backpacking stove should be designed so that it doesn't destroy itself when used in light wind. Flame and plastic don't mix well, who would have known??
review.name: The plastic melted on first use
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your response. I am sorry to hear about the problem that you have had with your MiniMo and we would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concern. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday. We look forward to hear from you.

review.reviewBody: This has been great: I love that I can adjust the burner so that I can also slow-cook things inside of the pot without it burning.  It was a little tricky in cold temperatures, but that has more to do with the fuel than anything else.  I've learned to keep the fuel in my coat while I am setting up camp to warm it up.
review.name: used on 5 or 6 trips: great buy!

review.reviewBody: Been good,  wish I went with the smaller one as I have used it mostly just to boil water but will be nice if  I want to cook with.

This stove lit reliably despite the weather unlike my
Old stove. I only had to angle it in font off me and block the wind once on a particularly windy day where my old one would have never lit at all. It did take a little longer to boil water on this day, but only by a minute or so. 

I don’t use the button to ignite and typically use a lighter. Just preference. 

It was really easy to cook almost anything including using the Summit Skillet which allowed me to cook things other than dehydrated meals. I loved controlling the temperature more!
review.name: Nothing beats a Jetboil

review.reviewBody: Worked flawlessly, and as advertised. Boils water in a matter of minutes, and made great coffee with the French press. Highly recommend for outdoor activities.
Not as limited as the standard jet boil and will boil just as fast.
review.name: Fast and versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As with all JetBoil stoves, the MiniMo does what it is supposed to do, and does it incredibly well. Want to boil water for a dehydrated meal or a hot beverage? This stove will accomplish the task easily. I have only one complaint about this model- it is shorter than the other models, on purpose, so food will scoop out easier. However, due to the short stature, it is also a bit fatter, and therefore feels like it takes up more room in the backpack.
review.name: A great stove, with one caveat

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from promo1024.com

review.reviewBody: Thank you for the speedy delivery and excellent customer service asking questions leading up to our purchase! Arrived sooner than promised and worked perfect for our initial need. Excited to take this bad girl camping and test the insulation and cutting board. The LandR Bins are also great, we have 4 and use them all the time... great to throw stuff you want to keep accessible in your car and not lug back and forth to hotel rooms when on car trips (like jackets and snacks) and to just keep your random beach or camping stuff in ready to go!

I love the attachment access points and really comfortable hauling around. Oh and the ice retention is great and the dry bin comes in handy for picnics with kiddos.

review.reviewBody:
After a soul-crushing experience trying to mount and seat a Continental Xynotal, I needed to re-tape my rim.  The tape was much thicker than I thought and not quite as sticky.  But it works like a charm.  I taped over the valve stem hole twice, which did the job.  Some instructions have the overlap at the opposite end of the valve hole, and others have you going around the rim twice.

I would like to give a shout out to the gear adviser who helped me pick this product and the size needed.  Thank you!
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: If you are setting up a set of tubeless wheels, look no further. The Stans tape was very easy to work with. Make sure to get a width which is a few mm wider than your rim. For example, a 30mm rim would benefit from a 33mm wide tape.

review.reviewBody: Used on Enve mountain wheels.  I was using gorilla tape, but went back to Stans.  Easy to install, lasts and easy to change when necessary.

review.reviewBody: These boots have been exactly what I needed to help me get through the cold New Jersey winters we get out here! I purchased them at the beginning of the winter season and must have logged well over 30 days with them just up until the water recently rose above 56 degrees (F). They hold water well, the grip on my board has been great, the velcro has held up fine, and the overall boot has not begun to leak or wear out. My only disappointment and reason why I can't give these the 5 stars they deserve is because the inner lining of the boot has begun to rip and some sand actually managed to get under the lining, as you can see in the photo. It is nothing that has resulted in water leaking in, or lack of grip while surfing, or even an uncomfortable wear. However, because I did opt to spend the extra money for the Psychotech models I was hoping to have received a slightly better quality that would hold up a little better. That aside I feel that I will still be able to get a solid 2-3 more winter seasons out of these with some minor repairs to that lining and honestly when these do go I will most likely get another pair.
review.name: Warmest Boots Ever, Minor Disappointment

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping for very warm and toasty mittens.
While these are very well made...they run small.
Unfortunately, the thumb space was very tight  making my thumbs very cold.
I checked the inside sizing tag a couple times as I could not believe these were XL size.
Here in Montana it can get very cold. These mittens will be "ok" in the warmer winter temps...say around 30 degrees but they will never be warm enough for temps below that.
I was hoping I could use them for winter biking at temps in the low 20's or even into the single digits. Not happening.
I would not purchase these again for the reasons stated above.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: Haven't worn them yet but they are very nice and I have no doubt they will be nice and warm

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding in Club Ride jerseys for the past 8yrs or so. The New West Jersey is pretty much my go to for trail rides whether its a chill lap with my kids, hunting PR's on trail rides, or hitting some lift serve flow trails. They always look good, the fit is what I would call "tailored". Not baggy, but not racer tight and with a great amount of stretch. They breathe really well and they are quick to dry without holding on to any funk. The rear pocket is nice if you're just needing some extra space for a driver's license and credit card for hitting brewery post ride, but I tend to not load it up with too much more or it gets a bit heavy and unbalanced.
These work great too if you wear them to the office with the plan of an end of the day ride. Love these jerseys!
review.name: I could wear these every day.

name: New West Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I like these pads. They don't have a lot of branding and they look nice and pad my surfboards well. However, they don't fit well on my xsporter pro racks. I want to have them closer to the edge of the bars and the velcro wraps run into where the bar connects to the rack, the "t-joint". I wish they had pads designed for the truck racks!
review.name: Nice Pads, not a great XSporter Fit

review.reviewBody: The best pad for the large Track Rack system!  Perfect protection for my windsurfing equipment, paddle boards or kayaks after work.  Plus as an outside HVAC sales contactor they look professional on my Z71 crew cab truck bed, and protect my rack from ladders.  I ordered the largest pads, however, with the three section's of the pad Velcro attachment flaps that wrap the Thule bar, I could only use the inner two because of the Thule outer rack vertical supports.  To avoid the vertical support, I attached and folded the pad outer Velcro flaps under the pad, sitting directly on rack top to the outer edge.  To keep the wind from becoming an issue when nothing is on the pads, I added single strap Velcro "one wrap tape" that self grips on the ends.  Problem solved!!
review.name: Best pad for large Thule Track Rack system!

review.reviewBody: Good product but in spite of website saying they would fit my Thule racks, the velcro only overlapped 1/2" which is definetly not enough for 60+ mph highway winds.
review.name: BAD FIT!
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on your Thule Surf Pads. I am sorry to hear the pads did not fit your rack system as expected, but I'm glad our customer support team was able to connect to discuss the issue. 
Thule Surf Pads fit various size crossbars, depending on the model. The "wide" size is able to cover crossbars of a similar size to Thule WingBar Evo crossbars up to Thule Xsporter Pro crossbars. However, thicker crossbars will have less overlap on the hook-and-loop fasteners. 
Because of their quick and easy installation, Thule Surf Pads are intended to be removed when not in use. When secured to the bars beneath a surfboard and strapped securely, there should be no issues with staying attached to the crossbars.

review.reviewBody: I have some of your Thule surf rack pads already in 24 inch. Was hoping to get another set for a second car. Can't find???  The 20 inch are okay but not as good
review.name: Surf Pads

review.reviewBody: These look great and I wanted to love them, but can't. I installed on a Volvo XC90 with Thule Wingbars and the wind vibration is terrible (the Wingbars by themselves make no noise). Based on the speed it can range from "why is my subwoofer so active?" to "am I having catastrophic drivetrain failure!?" The entire vehicle shakes and makes me nauseous. I guess I can just take them on and off each time I want to use them, but I'd prefer not to. My return window has expired, so I will just live with these until I find an alternative solution.
review.name: Unusable
comment:
Hello Ben,
Thank you for sharing your thoughts on the Thule Surf Pads. I'm sorry to hear you have not had a great experience with this accessory. 
Unfortunately, adding any accessory to the top of a vehicle can increase the wind resistance and noise generated, especially for more streamline and aerodynamic vehicles. The good news is, the Thule Surf Pads are designed to be easily installed and removed thanks to the hook-and-loop closures, so it is easy to take them off the vehicle when not in use to avoid loud wind resistance noise.

review.reviewBody: Sectional velcro design allows airflow to get under the pads and cause horrible vibration. I find them unusable.
review.name: Poor design, horrible vibration.
comment:
Thank you for your feedback on the Thule Surf Pad system. 
I understand your frustration with the vibrations generated by the system. Unfortunately, adding any accessory to the roof of a vehicle will disrupt the airflow and could cause noise. The Thule Surf Pads are designed to be easily removed when not in use to avoid this problem.

review.reviewBody: Great product! Very easy to install and works great
review.name: THULE ROOF BOX

review.reviewBody:
Fits great on a 3 inch wide roof rack.. 
glad I purchased it!
review.name: Love the style

review.reviewBody: Although these arrived too late for me to use this season I checked them out and am looking forward to using them. I had heard good things about them from another SUPer and have been using Thule products for many years and have never been disappointed.
review.name: Surf Pads

review.reviewBody: Protects my car and my board, easy on and off. Exactly what I needed!
review.name: Just what I needed

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Siskin 8L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Picked up this pack for short day rides where not much needs to be carried. The capacity and organization work good for having a place to throw a shell and carry a snack and a few other essentials, but the hydration system is terrible. 
For starters they could have made the zipper opening a few inches larger and it would have made all the difference regarding slipping the bladder into place. As it is the bladder needs to be wrestled in. The attachment to tie the top of the bladder up is another point of poor design. I don't have large hands (thank goodness), but the tiny little buckle has to be threaded into a tiny little hole in the top of the bladder and is so ridiculously frustrating I can't imagine trying to do this if you had large hands, let alone even one with small hands. On top of this the bite valve began leaking within a couple of months of limited use (using the pack a couple of times a week). I have used hydration packs for well over twenty years and have never had one go out this quickly. In fact, I am replacing it with a bite valve from my Camelbak bladder.
As stated, I like the pack, but with the bladder issues I would not recommend this pack and will be looking for an alternative and pass this on to the thrift store writing off my loss.
review.name: Nice pack, hate the hydration system

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] TLDR: Very comfy, easy to organize. Worth buying. I’m picky.

It’s an awesome day pack that helps you store all the essentials and nothing more in the best way possible. I absolutely love the keychain holder as it makes hours of searching for keys a thing of the past. Wearing the Siskin honestly felt like wearing nothing at all to me at least. The straps and back are very comfortable for hours of riding.

There is one thing I was not the biggest fan of however. I don’t like the straps holding the shove-it pocket in place. It makes reaching for tools and other stuff in the lower compartments in the zippered portion a hassle to get to. I kind of wish the straps were on the flap itself so they didn’t have to be in the way. If the straps had to be out that wide to make the straps usable, I think a good experiment for the development team to try is to design the Siskin with the side walls on the flap part instead of the back of the pack. It may not look as sleek that way, but I figured it might be worthwhile thinking about. 

In the meantime, I think I will survive with getting used to it as the shove-it pocket has saved me a couple of times because I’ve forgotten to account for a couple extra items before. 

In conclusion, the Siskin 8 has become my edc cycling pack no matter the type of riding the day has in store for me. The storage compartments make it easy to organize and its great for carrying everyday essentials on the trail. Given the opportunity to start over my purchase, I’d still buy the Siskin 8.
review.name: TLDR: Very comfy, easy to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the third osprey hydration pack I’ve bought trying to find something that suits a day (or half-day) hike and still has room for trail mix, a light jacket, headlamp, extra layer, sunglass case, legs from convertible shorts, etc. An 11 seemed too big but 8 is def too small. There’s room for almost nothing. Wish they’d build these with some genius expansion for days where the weather is questionable and you need to bring more than just the water.
review.name: This is the third osprey

review.reviewBody: Bought this for mtn biking so I need space for basic tools, 7idp/Sam Hill pro, protein bars and bike jacket. I don't pack a lot but this pack is not useful for much more than not much. I thought the 8 litre designation referred to the cargo capacity. it seems to refer to the total space the pack inhabits. I lost the nipple on the first ride, then the bladder sprung a leak near the top (but not on the seam). Ya, not impressed! Money not well spent.
review.name: I would NOT buy this product again!

review.reviewBody: Super nice quality, typical Osprey product where you keep finding nice and clever details as you use it. It's a perfect balance for size and utility for a day ride with the flexibility to carry a couple extra items and still barely notice it on your back.
review.name: Amazing pack for biking

name: Siskin 8L Hydration Backpack
Siskin 8L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: This rope is baller. Super clean cord and takes falls well, the sheath is extremely silky and is super light! If you aren?t scared of climbing on a skinny cord you?ll really like this rope :)
review.name: Sexy Cord

review.reviewBody:
Great rope. I've taken it out twice. The dry treatment is awesome and the rope handled well on a wet WI climb. I haven't fallen on it, but rapping down all 240 feet of it made it's expansion (and thus fall impact absorption) quite evident. If you are considering this rope for alpine and remote climbs, I would tell you this: 52g/m is light, but 80 meters of it is not. That said, the lightest triple rated dry rope is 48g/m, so it doesn't get much better than this.

Update: Core shot after about 100 pitches. My own fault for using it to climb wandering sandstone multipitch. Still love the rope and am considering buying another one. Not as much of a workhorse as a 10mm, but for a 3x certified DD alpine rope, it's fairly durable.
review.name: Great Rope So Far
comment: Hey Caleb, glad to hear it's working out! Thanks for the detailed review.

name: Argon Double Dry Climbing Rope - 8.8mm

review.reviewBody: The jacket is a pretty colour and I look forward to wearing it this winter! I plan to use it as my snowboarding jacket. I was hoping there would be a place to put my mountain pass near the hip or the sleeve for easy scanning. I am 5'8 almost 5'9 with long arms, so I was happy that the XL had long enough arm lenghts. The jacket is not as baggy/loose on me as I was hoping but, it will still serve me well! Looking forward to seeing how it performs in the cold Quebec (Canada) weather on the hills!
review.name: Functional Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for the value. Held up well during heavy powder and snowboarding throughout my ten days in Utah.
review.name: Great Value

review.reviewBody: I liked everything about this jacket but it was just too long for me.   I am 5'3" and this was at least 6 inches too long.  It hit at my knee so I had to return it.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: Spacious and long fitting over the butt, it works really well in the snow too - waterproof and warm! Super stylish and comfortable! I love the two way zipper  since it gives you extra space in hip when sitting down on the lifts. the hood fits perfectly over a helmet and will stay on while skiing -  the hood is very very loose and covers your eyes if you don’t have a helmet on though… runs maybe slightly bigger for arm and shoulder size, but it’s perfect for layering and it keeps you very warm. I’m 5’10 usually medium or large in jackets, I went with medium and Im happy with it - love that the sleeves are long - a huge plus for me with my long arms.
review.name: Stylish, comfortable, and waterproof!

review.reviewBody: My wife loves this jacket.  She says it's very warm and durable.  The large zipper is much better than the small one they put on the men's version.  Also the zipper cover gives it a better look than the men's version of the same jacket.
review.name: Better than the Men's version

review.reviewBody: Love everything about the jacket - great fit and roomy enough to add additional layers + not baggy when I didn't need to. Just spent a week skiing in northern VT where we had single digit temps at the start of the week, and mid 40s our last day, and the jacket was perfectly comfortable at both extremes. The only negative is the lack of decent inner pockets. There is only one inside large goggle size mesh pocket  - there should be two - and one small inside breast pocket w horrible snap - here too is needed two breast pockets w zippers. Otherwise I am really happy, and carrying less stuff on my body is not the worst thing.
review.name: Great Jacket In All Temps

review.reviewBody: Moveable, waterproof and warm! Highly recommend this product
review.name: Perfect for First Time User

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable ski jacket! I ordered a medium so I was able to layer underneath but still have movement. A lot of pockets
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: In love with this color! This jacket's fits is great, the liner is of perfect thickness so I can add base to mid-layers and not look huge.
review.name: New ski jacket

review.reviewBody: High-quality, fits as expected. Excellent jacket for the slopes. Love the teal color.
review.name: Perfect for snow fun

name: FireFall/2 Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good insulation but more bulky than expected. They were hard getting into my wader booties. Simms g4 waders
Well made & warm bootie but too small to wear heavier socks inside them. Too soon to tell, weather-wize, but his might limit their use for coldest winter weather wading.
review.name: Warm but tight & short for men's size 12

review.reviewBody: Great fit on my feet, they definitely provide good warmth, I wish I would have got one smaller though as they’d fit in my stockings a bit better. I simply remove my feet from them while they are already in my stockings. Put less undue pulling etc on the stockings.
review.name: Great addition to my layering system

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately these are too bulky to fit into even my largest wading boots.  I think you would need to go 2 sizes up to make these work.  So now you have to buy a new pair of boots just to accommodate these puffy booties.  It is a shame, I was very excited to try them.
review.name: Just a little too much to pack into a wading boot.

review.reviewBody:
I love the concept of these and want to love them, but sizing is off.  
I'm am 11-11.5 and I bought the size large per the size guide.  With regular socks, my toes were jammed into the ends of the booties.  I would suggest sizing up.
review.name: Fits Small- go a size up if in doubt

review.reviewBody: Really wanted these booties in our arsenal.   However, I purchased two pairs and both left and right bootie was cut differently.  Both rights were pointed in toe area and narrower; causing foot to rest on stitching.   Returned.
review.name: Quality Issue

review.reviewBody: Really wanted to like these in our cold Northern Rivers.  Purchased two pairs; one for both the wife and I.  Both right feet are cut different than the left one; the right bootie is too narrow and its tip is more pointed than left bootie.  In addition, the stitching rubs on inside of the foot on the narrow (right) bootie.
review.name: Quality Control Issue

name: Bulkley Bootie
