review.reviewBody:
After using an Osprey Atmos 65 for nearly a decade, I switched to the Granite Gear mainly because a friend of mine was getting into backpacking and I gave them the Osprey as an excuse to try a new pack. 
 
While the Osprey served me well, the Granite Gear seemingly fixes everything I disliked about it. 

(This review is based on several backpacking trips, including one where I did a 10 mile, 4,000 foot ascent in a single day.)

Despite being 35 percent lighter without much of a supportive back panel compared to the Osprey, I don't feel any comfort is lost. In fact, the Osprey would always pinch my left shoulder no matter how much I tried to adjust it — it would always be sore at the end of a trip. The problem is gone with the Granite Gear.

Other problems it fixes: The side pockets were too small and too shallow on the Osprey — my Nalgene bottles could pop out if something knocked against them. And it was especially hard to put bottles pack in them when the pack was on my back — I could never easily reach my arms back there. None of that is the case with the Granite Gear — the pockets are luxuriously big and deep. 

Another annoyance with the Osprey was that the hip pouches were too shallow, and when the hip belt was pulled tight around my waste they could be difficult to open and close. Problem again solved on the Granite Gear.

Finally, I love that the bag is covered in compression straps — really well thought out. 

So far I've been very happy with the Granite Gear. Highly recommend.
review.name: All around excellent

review.reviewBody:
I got to use the pack for an overnight stop. Plenty of room for all the necessary gear and any additional stuff.
Only feedback would be to have a lighter coloured interior to make it a bit easier locating things in the dark.
review.name: Very good backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son to do philmont in 2025.  He's done some training hikes and overnights so far.  Carries load well, plenty of room, very adjustable, lightweight, sturdy, and very versatile with the daypack feature and lashing options.  Only one minor 'flaw' is on the black backpack all the buckles and straps are black which just all blend together making it tough to know what goes where.  Fairly minor but bit of a nuisance.  Regardless, I highly recommend.
review.name: Great backpack for price

review.reviewBody: Pack fits great once properly adjusted, and carries weight like a champ.  Stretchy material allows for cramming in a little extra.  Nice and light for a 60L pack.  Happy camper.
review.name: Really nice all-around pack

review.reviewBody:
It's new to me and I've used it for one day hike and one multiday trip (3 nights).  So far, I've been very happy.  It's not light enough to be a true ultralight (ie close to 3 lbs not < 2) but it's far more comfortable than a true ultralight and far more capable with lots of features those don't have.  Actually in terms of comfort and features it rivals many packs at 5+ lbs.  
The waist belt is very comfortable.  The straps adjust to fit nicely.  AT 6'1" & 175 lbs I'm just between the regular and tall size, I went with regular and it fits well.  I really like the adjustability of the waist strap, it actually gets thin enough for me.  The side pockets are easy to reach while walking.  The removable top was handy for a quick summit side jaunt.  Overall I was very impressed.
review.name: Performs like a pack twice its weight

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a through hike. Good fitting bag and great value. Ensure you get the right size.
review.name: Good Pack for Long Hikes

review.reviewBody:
This is a good sized pack that handles weight well with several adjustment areas to customize fit. It does lack many external pockets as the design is too maximize the size of the main compartment. There are numerous straps to cinch everything down in many places and at different angles so your gear will stay put and not rattle around whether it's inside the main compartment, in the side pockets, it even lashed outside.

I do worry about the extensive use of spandex and how it will hold up to long term deep backcountry use, but it's completely unscathed after one such trip of 3 days and 2 nights traversing both on and off trail segments.

Note the pack can get quite tall if you use the full volume and the top compartment, especially if you set it up with the straps a little lower. Unless you have a long torso, it can easily extend to the top of your head or beyond meaning you'll need to be careful ducking under things. 

All in all, is recommend this bag to someone looking for a reasonably lightweight pack with high volume and good weight handling. If long term disability become an issue, I'll amend this review.
review.name: Great, Simple Bag

review.reviewBody: If you need to fit a sleeping bag inside, not the bag for you. Took up 70% of the available interior space. Not sure that the few ounces saved in weight are worth the lack of space/lack of gear attachments.
review.name: Light weight but doesn't hold much gear

review.reviewBody: This pack is advertised as weighing 3 lbs but actually weighs 3 lbs 11 oz. I suggest anyone buying it keep that in mind.
review.name: Not 3 lbs

review.reviewBody:
This pack is a total tank. I live in MN and love to camp in the winter. I purposely loaded this pack to 52 pounds. The weight rating of 50 pounds and I did not feel weighed down at all. The really stiff backboard really helps hold the weight close to your back and keep your posture upright. 

I own an Osprey Atmos and carries no where near as comfortable for this amount of weight. The greatest part of this pack is that the Blaze is only 3 lbs. It is mind blowing to have such a lightweight pack carry such a heavy load. The GG Blaze is really in a tier of its own for weight and ability to carry 40-50 or more. Nothing compares.

The cinch straps are great and I carry my snowshoes and tent on the outside. Ive even cinched 20 pounds of wood to my pack to make sure I had dry wood for a weekend trip here in the MN winters.

It has a compartment zipper on the side to pull everything you need out without having to pull from the top so I can get straight to the bottom of my pack if need be.

The top lid is small but can be used by itself for daytrips. The hip pockets are big and easily accesible.

I literally cannot think of anything wrong with this pack, There is no backpack that is even in its realm of competition. Packs that carry heavy weights are usually 4-7 lb packs. The fact the Blaze carries such and is 3 lbs speaks volumes to the innovation Granite Gear brings. 

The Blaze may not feel as comfy as an Osprey, but you cannot beat this for heavy winter loads. I enjoyed the stiffness of the Blaze because it really helps align your spine and keep proper posture even when exhausted.

My Osprey will now become my 3 season pack and my Blaze is now my late fall/Winter pack.
review.name: Built to carry burdens and give you joys

name: Blaze 60L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the lightweight, slight stretchiness; feel more sleek and wearable compared to most rain pants. Have not tested in the rain yet. I am a woman with athletic build/muscular thighs (25.5" at thickest point). 5'10, 31" waist 41" hips; the size M was too tight on the thighs but fit perfectly through waist and hips. Went with a size L, which fits slightly loose in the waist (can be fixed with the drawstring) but overall good fit elsewhere. The women's version was too short in the rise for me, this one is longer and perfect. The inseam is generous.
review.name: lightweight, long slim fit

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for, true to size, excellent quality
review.name: Exactly what I was looking

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great pants for hiking! They are fully waterproof and stretch so they are really comfortable. Favorite pants and fully reccomend.
review.name: Amazing

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wish I would have had these 20 years ago...I've been struggling to get in/out of rain gear this whole time. For not being Goretex these stop rain dead in its tracks.
review.name: full length zipper is a game changer

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: New, right out of the bag, button pulled out of pants. The button was not properly secured to fabric. I made a warranty claim that took them forever to get back to me. They want me to pay shipping to have the pants repaired.
review.name: Black Diamond poor customer service

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Mainly because the fit is perfect, but also because of the zips on the sides. Perfect for cooling. I use them mostly for when the trails are wet in the morning, so I can zip and unzip as I go.
review.name: Best Rain Pant I've Ever Had

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: These work great & have a full-zip, which is hard to find.
review.name: Great function

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality and very comfortable. Love the full zip aspect of it to be able to put them on with crampons, shoes, etc without taking them off.
review.name: Stormline Stretch rain pants

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m 5’11” and 178 lbs with a 32 inch inseam.   The cut in these rain pants was super odd -very tight.  I returned them
review.name: Super narrow and odd cut

review.itemreviewed: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice product, a bit tight on the waist but happy with it
review.name: Nice product

name: Stormline Stretch Full Zip Rain Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very pleased with this jacket. Well designed seems to be very waterproof. I was able to try it out in some heavy winds & rains recently, worked great! Love the rose gold color, ordered it a size up so it could be worn over a barn coat in cold weather & that was perfect as well.
review.name: Great waterproof jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket fits well and has useful pockets and hood.  However, the velcro cuffs on the sleeves are quite annoying because you can't roll the cuffs up easily, and the sleeves are longish.
review.name: The cuffs are annoying

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Waterproof, lightweight, and fits great. Exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: Great cut, feel and protection!  This coat looks great and gets the job done.
review.name: Looking good, feeling dry

review.reviewBody: Good color, length, and fit! Light weight but sturdy. Will be great for upcoming travel. Long enough to provide hip coverage.
review.name: Perfect Gortex for travel

review.reviewBody: My jacket is beautiful and definitely waterproof. I bought a large to fit over a vest or sweater, so it is roomy but that's okay. I love it and would like to give it 5 stars but I'm confused by why there is no drawstring or velcro or snap to keep the hood on my head in high wind/rain. It feels like there is a drawstring on the inside edge of the hood, but alas. I think the theory is that you can play with the edge and make the hood stay up but I couldn't. A simple string would help. So close to perfect.
review.name: Perfect---except it needs a hood drawstring....

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Material is soft but sturdy. Great for rain and snow
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color and it's water proof! It fits as expected and feels like it's quality made, what I expect from Marmot. I like how the hood fits over my head so it's secure in the rain and wind.
review.name: Good Buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is life saver for extreme conditions. I have used in severe rain, wind and it protected me from getting wet and cold. Great length and  good fit.
review.name: Great jacket for rain, wind and cold

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for a packable raincoat for an August trip to Alaska and my friend recommended Marmot. I was not sure what to expect but when I got it in the mail it was perfect! Light weight yet you feel protected wearing it. 5 stars!!
review.name: Perfect Jacket for Alaska Vacation!

name: Minimalist Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots didn't need any breaking in and were comfortable from the first time wearing them. They keep my feet dry and are very supportive for my ankles. I gave a 4 stars because the only downside for me is that the tongue is attached inside, making them a bit tight over the top of the foot when putting them on. This limits the thickness of the socks that I can wear, so I will not be able to wear these boots in colder weather.
review.name: Very comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Chaussure faite assez large ce qui me convient, légère et confortable. La couleur est pale et elles sont salissante. Pour la durabilité je n’ai fait que 3 petites randonnées, donc je vais voir sur le plus long terme.
review.name: Je l’ai acheté il y a 1mois et je suis satisfaite

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This style does not fit my foot the same way all my other Salomons do. Toe box is considerably wider, arch support feels lower, but that may be the effect of the wider/deeper toe. Shoe feels quite warm, which will likely be welcome during winter months. Unsure about durability as I've only worn once.
review.name: Fit is different from other salomon styles.
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just took these awesome new hiking shoes on a 3-day backcountry camping trip, and they were fantastic! The grip was solid on dry, uphill trails, and they kept my feet dry when crossing small creeks. The upper lock for the laces is genius—it keeps them snug right around the ankle. Only downside is the laces tend to come undone a little too easily; however, this is always my issue whenever wearing sneakers/hiking shoes. // Overall, these shoes were a great choice. Plus! -no break-in time needed; I wore them straight out of the box on my hike!
review.name: (3-day backcountry) – Comfy, Grippy, and Dry!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve worn the speed cross for 10 years trail running. I have size 5-6 narrow feet. I figured the Salomon hikers would too be a narrow good fit. I slid inside of the shoe causing blisters on the top middle and back of my foot. The upper cuff bruised my Achilles. This shoe fits like a hoka which also was very wide. The sole did not hold up on rocky terrain. Expensive bummer test run for Teton terrain.
review.name: Too wide causing blisters
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these several weeks ago, and they are roomy  for my toes which is wonderful since I had foot surgery.  I can wear these with no discomfort.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tested these shoes out on a dry rocky trail in Southern California hoping they could serve as a lighterweight option to my Quest 4s. But as I navigated various elevation changes with loose gravel and dirt the grip wasn't strong enough and I slipped multiple times and even fell once. Overall the shoes are comfortable and I initially liked them, but with the lack of grip, I wouldn't recommend them especially if you're in wet conditions or unsure of your footing. Also, I found the tongue of the shoe a bit hard to close, and depending on the weather, it may be challenging to keep your feet dry.  Considering how expensive these are it's a bummer they're more like a walking shoe.
review.name: Cute but no grip
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for something really cushioned and these do the job amazingly. They have helped me recover from tendon issues and get walking again. Grip surprisingly good and the gtx lining has held up in light rain and mud/puddles. Comfortable toe box with plenty of room and a narrowing middle/angle ankle sections which keeps my foot in securely. Love them.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very comfortable and when dry they have exceptional grip on rock slabs.  I was lured into a false sense of security when I discovered they are extremely slippery when wet. The other day, on a mountain trail with a lot of scrambling I was slipping almost constantly and fell several times. I will only use these on dirt paths from now on.
review.name: Slippery when wet
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought the Elixir Activ Mid Gore-Tex for a 6-day 52-mile hike in the Columbia River Gorge, OR. I barely broke them in but they were great. No blisters at all. They have a lot more cushion than the Outpulse which is why I choose this boot even though the Outpulse seemed to fit my feet a little better in shape form. One thing I think is missing is a second top hook for the laces. That would have been really nice for a snugger fit for rock scrambling at a 25 grade. Overall though, very happy with these.
review.name: Excellent Light Weight Hiker

name: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
got these on sale (so I did not have lofty expectations). Having said that Whitespace has a high material quality which this item (and matching coat) did not disappoint. In general I am a fan of the brand at sale prices. 

HOWEVER, unlike more mature brands, the layout and features really falls short of build quality. All the pockets big are LOW, like low thigh to knee unusable low, so you phone getting bounced on the leg for the entire day. Would have been far better to include specific pockets up higher with smaller volumes. 

The fit and style are on point. I want to love them but they will be backup spring kit to my daily driver.
review.name: High Quality but falls short

review.reviewBody:
This was probably the worst customer experience Ive had. I accidentally purchased a final sale item that I didn't realize it was final sale. The item came in and was one size smaller.. I called the company to see if I can exchange for a bigger size. "Their policy doesn't allow exchanges either on final sale item".. This was my first time shopping here and I will not be shopping here again. I can't believe there's nothing they could have done.. I even offered to ship the item on my own dime. 

Worst customer experience ever
review.name: Won't be shopping at backcountry again

name: Performance 3L Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love the feel of these bibs! 
I am 5’1” and 105lbs. My body type is pretty average for a petite gal! Seeing how these were built, politely will say these are not built for anyone in my height range. Able to comfortably wear a medium size layer underneath. However the hips sit way lower than they need to creating a curve lower than visually appealing. 
What I’m saying here if you’re buying this for looks at my height, probably not the best idea. But if you’re buying for functionality these are great quality!
review.name: Warm for Michigan, questionable for petite babes!

review.reviewBody: 5'6 145# muscular build, the medium fit great with plenty of room for layers underneath. These bibs are high quality, completely waterproof, and comfortable.
review.name: Great fit, great quality

review.reviewBody: Liked the features and fabric of these bibs but was very disappointed to find they did not have proper potty access - requires taking off everything on top and likely dragging the bibs along the floor in order to pee.  So sad.
review.name: Nice but not accessible!

review.reviewBody: The material of these pants is beautiful. Lightly insulated, quiet, stretchy and comfortable. The design of the pants is terrible. Firs of all, you would have to take everything off in order to use the bathroom. There is no way to drop these pants without taking the straps off, undoing the zipper in the front and pulling the whole thing down. This is a deal-breaker for me. The next issue is the pockets. The way they are designed makes them stick out even when zipped shut. Maybe not a problem if you are super skinny and the pants are super loose, but for those of us who aren't as thin or who don't want the pants to be super baggy, this just looks terrible. They fit true to size and I am disappointed but these are definitely getting sent back.
review.name: Great Material, Poor Design

review.reviewBody: I've had these a few weeks and out of the box, I appreciated the quality. I've since worn them in different conditions on the hill, and they've performed well all around. Dry, warm, durable and style for days.
review.name: Tasty Bibs

review.reviewBody: Bibs that are flattering and beyond comfortable for curvy figures- also true to size which I’ve never experienced in a bib before. Room for hips, I can sit comfortably, have unrestricted range of motion, and somehow I don’t look like the Michelin man in them too. I don’t know how they pulled this off, but these things are awesome.
review.name: Yes, please!

review.reviewBody: I wore this bib for the craziest winter Tahoe has seen in years! Love how comfortable it is- from the insulation, the feel of the fabric is quiet and soft, ample pocketing and love the rise of it under my jacket!
review.name: Favorite Bib!

name: Powder Maven Bib - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Norrona Wool Hoodie - Men's  online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love Norrona products, own several. This has a major design flaw. Just used it for 7 days in the winds then swapped it out for the hood less version I left in the car for remaining 7 days.

Here?s the problem: the hood has no elastic means of securing it to your head ? so if you are a person who occasionally moves their head (while walking, sitting, or sleeping) the hood shifts around and you get half your head hooded (including your face) and the other half not ? and various similar iterations. Basically ? the hood has a mind of its own. Not sure what massive Nordic head this was designed for, but not for anybody who doesn?t have Thorhead.

Boo, hiss, Norrona, what were you thinking: kangaroo pocket but not elastic on the hood, come on, get your priorities right. 

Will lay it in a pyrrhic canoe and send it to Asgard.
review.name: Would give it -5 ?? if I could
comment:
Hey Daniel!  I'm so sorry to hear you weren't 100% stoked on the hoodie!  I went ahead and reached out via email, we'd be happy to offer a free return or exchange for you.

For what it's worth, i LOVE my smartwool hooded baselayer below.  It can be really hard to find a merino layer like this with the elastic you're looking for--but that said my (reasonably sized non-Nordic) dome has been unrestricted in this piece.  Feel free to reach out for an exchange, or for suggestions on other options!

https://www.backcountry.com/smartwool-merino-250-baselayer-hoodie-mens?skid=SWLZ86Y-GOLOLIBLA-L&ti=UExQIENhdDpNZW4ncyBCYXNlbGF5ZXIgVG9wczoxOjM6YmMtbWVucy1iYXNlbGF5ZXItdG9wcw==

review.reviewBody: Every other piece of merino wool layer I have/had develops/ed holes quickly. I've used this thing for 2 seasons now and still no holes. Definitely my favorite baselayer. Would be awesome if it had a zipper pocket somewhere instead of kangaroo pocket.
review.name: Comfortable and impressively durable

review.reviewBody: The snowshoes ripped my snowpants with the small pin of the heel ( helper to climb mountain)
review.name: Light , good quality but with a default

review.reviewBody: I have spent countless hours in snowshoes. I hike, hunt, and work my maple syrup bush with them. I always ran with what I thought was a great snowshoe until I tried my Revo. The grip, comfort, and lightweight blew me away. When I think of the miles and miles Ive walked, I can't believe I just never knew how much better it could have been. Shame on me.
review.name: Revo Explore

review.reviewBody:
I have used these almost every weekend during winter for 3 years, and I love them. I live in Western Colorado, and have tested these to their limit. The only issue I am having is that the springs on my bindings tend to pop out, which can make tightening my straps on the trail kinda tricky. This started happening after year 2 of use. However, I can say that the ratchet function is the single best thing about these, and it makes them stand out from the competition. I do a lot of backcountry snowshoeing in deep snow, uphill, downhill, over trees, whatever you can imagine. I just really like snowshoeing, okay?? Lol. Anyway, these have held up miraculously well, and outperformed every other snowshoe that my friends wore during our adventures. They all use the traditional strap system, and their shoes simply won't stay on. In deep snow, the snow pushes their straps off the hook, or the snow packs in between the shoe and the strap, or the strap breaks. Not so with these. The straps fall off maybe once a month, in seriously weird conditions. I cannot say enough how much I love these! 

As a short female, though, I look forward to upgrading this year into the women's version so that I can try out that narrower stride. I do often step on my own shoes because I am very smol. Other than the buckle spring and my own extreme smolness, there is nothing I would do to change these shoes. I would recommend to anyone who wants to go off of a groomed trail.
review.name: My Fav

review.reviewBody: awesome snowshoes, love the ratchet style bindings.
review.name: awesome snowshoes, love the ratchet

review.reviewBody: Just received mine and they look great. Just noticed the 4 little empty holes on the front edge. The black plastic cutouts leaves them accessible. Is there a function for these, like an add-on product?
review.name: Revo Explore 25

review.reviewBody: Easy to put on. Packs away very well. All around great!
review.name: Easy to put on. Packs

review.reviewBody: Easy to use binding system with good grip in a variety of conditions. Highly recommended.
review.name: Easy to use binding system

review.reviewBody: I've been on four snowshoes hikes with my Revo Explore snowshoes. I think the straps should be twice as thick, and the ratchet controls and releases should be bigger and easier to operate with gloves or mittens. I think these snowshoes were designed by people sitting at computers instead of snowshoeing on trails.
review.name: COULD BE BETTER

review.reviewBody:
+solid weight
+traction/grip
+Televator for walking on a steep slope (contruction could be better)
+HyperLink binding is ideal for smaller snowboard shoe (approx max 44-45? - I have 43 Thirty Two Prion)
+probably more durable than Lightning
+a bit flexible - good for traverses and uneven, bumpy surface

-binding packability for downhill is worse than usual ordinary textile straps (but not bad)
-Televator could be more robust and could have MORE TILT ANGLE SETTINGS
-the metal frame could be REPLACEABLE and GRINDABLE similar to the crampons
-possibility to use bigger snowboard boots

Try to develop: 
Some binding system similar to semiautomatic crampons (with possibility to use this binding as a semiautomatic crampons independently)
Some binding system using arbitrary snowboard binding (similar idea to splitboard)
Possibility to change only binding system for different boot type not the base deck (=frame with plastic)
Make your snowshoes to have maximal possible replaceable parts
review.name: Great for snowboarding

review.reviewBody: These things are amazing! I don't understand the reviews about the bindings and their comfort. They are SUPER easy to use, and super comfortable. It might have a lot to do with what shoes you use. But they appear well built, and they float great in the snow. And the grip...oh the grip! It's literally like having a CJ on each foot. I can get in places that I never dared on foot alone, and they are quick to strap on and light to carry in--a great purchase.
review.name: Like Jeep for my Feet!

name: Revo Explore Snowshoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very flexible and is not binding across my shoulders.
review.name: Flexible

review.reviewBody:
Never have I seen a product page that was so bad I almost didnt buy the product because of it, but this one almost got me.

Despite all the confusing info here, trust me this *is* the jacket you want. I ski at 12k feet in the rockies, and this jacket with a wool baselayer is about all you need until temps drop below freezing.

According to the product and tags I received after ordering in winter 2023/24 

-it IS recco
-it IS full waterproof

This jacket is total wind blocking, very warmly insulated, super comfy to wear, if you get it a little big you can layer like crazy under it with no problem, theres every pocket you could want for a long day on the slopes, theres a powder skirt with 2 snap positions to accomodate body and clothing variability, removable hood that can fit whatever helmet underneath and cinches nicely for long chair rides, vents under the arms that do a wonderful job of thermoregulating

Definite buy in my opinion, Im considering getting a second one as backup
review.name: READ THIS FIRST

The material is thicker than you would expect in a t-shirt and probably a little too thick to wear as a summer shirt above 80 degrees but quality is decent. What was not great was the difference in size between the two. One shirt was at least 2 inches wider than the other even though they were purchased in the exact same size. I would say this is not unusual for Backcountry branded items so something to be aware of. At the price, I did not even bother returning and put the larger one straight in the donation bin but both run large in general.
review.name: Sizing is all over the place...

review.reviewBody: I love the design (hence why I bought it), but the actual shirt that it's printed on is not going to be one of my favorites. It's made from a thicker material that is not so comfortable and fits a bit boxy. We'll see if it softens up and breaks in as it gets worn and washed more, but at this point I wouldn't by another one of these shirts.

review.reviewBody: GREAT shoe. Legit makes a difference running and doesn’t change your gait
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: I bought the Endorphin Pro 4 as my first 'race' shoe after getting the Nike Zoom Vaporfly 4% back n 2018.  I have been a longtime Saucony Guide runner, so have been wearing the brand almost exclusively since then.  The Pro 4 is great.  Super lightweight and bouncy overall. I have no issue with the thin upper material, as it fits snug and is breathable.  The laces bother some in reviews, but I find they don't cut off circulation and like the stretch.  Overall, super happy with the shoe and performance.
review.name: Light, springy, fast!

review.reviewBody: The design, performance, manufacturing quality and weight are more than wonderful. They help increase speeds and are comfortable after the end of the exercise, especially the tiring exercises. Wonderful.

I have had the opportunity to run in these 4 times (8 miles each time) and Saucony has another winner. I've had multiple pairs of the Pro's in my shoe rotation since the release of the first version, as with previous versions the Pro's are my favorites - I also run in the Speed, Triumph, along with the Kinvera, Kinvera Pro, various carbon and non by Asics, On, Mizuno, and Hoka. A few of the Saucony's are always part of the rotation. Well done, love how they look and make me feel fast every time I lace them up.
review.name: Another Great Pro Release
comment: Thanks for the great feedback Steve!

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for my marathons.  They are light and springy.  I did bump up a half a size and they fit great.
review.name: Marathon shoes
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

review.name: Beautiful & Great Performance Shoes

review.reviewBody: I have used this parka from the rainy Alaskan peninsula to the cold dry deserts of the southwest.  Plain and simple it’s the best parka that I have ever owned. It’s light weight, durable, comfortable and crazy warm.
review.name: Great parka

review.reviewBody: I originally got this jacket for a mountaineering trip but unfortunately, the trip had to be canceled so I've been unable to test this jacket in extreme conditions. However, I have tested it while out on the slopes watching my daughter do the whole ski team thing. In windy and cold conditions this jacket is toasty. Super lightweight as well.
review.name: Like wearing a sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: Good quality overall. Heavy, zipper is annoying as others have noted, and fits really large. I am 6'3" 185, and the size Large is way too big around my mid section. It is quite warm, and the overall design (adjustable hood, elastic cuffs, etc) is quite good. If I had not purchased on EV, I would return for a Medium. Seems very durable overall though. Also, it has a stuff pocket, but it is challenging to use.
review.name: Fits large.

review.reviewBody: This is my daily jacket for the past 2 years.  In northern MN it's cold, alot.  It's March now and getting to about 20 degrees during the day and it almost feels too warm and time to drop to a lighter down jacket.  Some feathers pop out randomly, otherwise an amazing jacket.
review.name: Daily use

review.reviewBody: Have had this parka for about 4 months and used it quite extensively from sub-zero alpine starts to stuffing in a sea to summit 6.5L sack and leaving it in my pack all day. Has held up great and surprisingly not a single tear or hole has formed even with pretty decent abuse around pointy objects
review.name: Has worked on even the coldest days

review.reviewBody: I love this parka!  It is exponentially lighter then the two decade old MEC (dear old friend) of equivalent temperature rating it replaced.   It didn't get five stars because of the zipper.  It doesn't function smoothly when new, and I can see problems when cold, tired, and gloved, when you really need the parka's warmth.  The tear-resistant 3D printed material for a down parka is as brilliant as it is revolutionary.
review.name: Perfect, except for the zipper

review.reviewBody: Great parka overall and one of the cheaper ones compared to the "elite" parkas on the market. No rips or tears after a year and the material seems very durable. I would say I have lost a normal amount of feathers for a down parka. The jacket is definitely on the bulkier side but I've been in 5 degree Fahrenheit weather with just a t shirt underneath and its been sufficient.
My normal size was perfect for layering over a lot of gear. The zipper though... for how expensive the parka is, that really needs to be improved.
review.name: Excellent warmth, good size, poor zipper

review.reviewBody:
Wore this jacket in a couple sub-zero days (without factoring wind chill, so yeah, it was COLD) working up at the ski resort. Even just standing around I was plenty warm!

There are two downsides I have found:
1. There seems to be an unusual amount of down filling falling out. This typically happens with new down but it seems as if there is TOO much coming out.
2. The zipper is a little tricky to zip up sometimes; ESPECIALLY while wearing thicker gloves. I've had to remove my gloves every time to get it going which isn't ideal in the cold.
Still an excellent jacket!
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: I was expecting to get a VERY puffy jacket, but the jacket is medium fill at best. The photos of the jacket on the model are very very misleading and the jacket will never get as bulky as the photos suggest. I wanted a bomber, super thick belay parka, but I found this parka not quite warm enough. I don’t care about weight. For the price, I would recommend other manufacturers.
review.name: Cool, but the model photos are misleading

name: Vision Down Parka - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Lithium 25L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this on hikes and I have used this traveling on the plane, holds the laptop and big enough for everything else.
review.name: perfect bag

review.reviewBody: Excellent daypack for travel. I wore this pack while travelling in asia and it was comfortable as well as accessible with so many useful pockets. The ability to remove the waist support strap is also a very unique feature.
So many pockets and storage places. Removable belt strap was key when I needed a lighter pack on a shorter day.
Perfect size for daypack, but adequate for fast and light ice climb or alpine climbs. Very comfortable and breathable. I really like the ice axe tethers on this small bag.
Super high quality and comfortable to use. Great for 4-8hr hikes.

name: Lithium 25L Daypack
